title: Kerala Chief Secretary Sarada Muraleedharan to hear suspended IAS officer N. Prasanth on April 16
content: In his defence statement given to Kerala government in February, Prasanth sought a hearing that is digitally recorded and streamed live. Reportedly, the request has been granted

title: Heatwave onslaught in large parts of India
content: A searing heatwave swept through many states of central and western India on Tuesday, April 8, with temperatures soaring to a scorching 46.4 degrees Celsius in Rajasthan’s Barmer

title: Justice Sanjeev Kumar appointed as acting Chief Justice of Jammu & Kashmir High Court
content: On April 4, 2025, the Supreme Court Collegium recommended the appointment of Justice Arun Palli as the Chief Justice of the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh

title: Supreme Court to hear pleas over ₹50 lakh cap on Centre aid for rare diseases
content: The Supreme Court will review petitions challenging the ₹50 lakh cap on government assistance for treating rare diseases, including spinal muscular atrophy. The case will be heard by a bench headed by Justice P S Narasimha starting May 13

title: No rift in alliance with BJP in Karnataka, says H.D. Kumaraswamy
content: He said JD(S) is not joining the Janakrosha Yatre of the BJP, as it is an exercise to strengthen their party

title: BSF jawan injured in IED blast along Pakistan border
content: A BSF party was undertaking an “area domination” patrol ahead of the border security fence during the night, and it detected multiple improvised explosive devices (IEDs) with concealed wires “well inside” the Indian territory,” the force said

title: Belagavi-Mysuru flight emergency landing: Aircraft handling by crew was a factor in incident, says DGCA report
content: DGCA report states that the probable cause of the incident was failure to manage the aircraft vertical path and improper Crew Resource Management performance

title: Nearly three months after attack on Saif Ali Khan, Bandra police file charge sheet in Mumbai court
content: “The charge sheet consists of evidence against the accused Bangldeshi national  Mohammad Shariful Islam,” an official said without elaborating

title: Saidai Duraisamy urges AIADMK to follow M.G.R. and Jayalalithaa’s approach of political reconciliation
content: Mr. Duraisamy told journalists that both M.G.R. and Jayalalithaa had taken under their fold those leaders who were once extremely critical of them

title: India engaged with U.S. to seal trade pact: EAM Jaishankar
content: India aims to firm up a bilateral trade pact with the U.S. amid Trump’s tariffs, says External Affairs Minister Jaishankar

title: Jammu and Kashmir Mirwaiz claims Muslim body not allowed to hold meeting over Waqf issue
content: Authorities prevent MMU meeting at Mirwaiz’s residence to discuss Waqf Bill, sealing off access to religious representatives from J&K

title: No loan waiver for Wayanad landslides victims; only rescheduling, restructuring: Centre tells Kerala HC
content: The Centre made this submission in an affidavit filed in response to High Court's query on whether the loans availed of by the affected individuals could be waived

title: Delhi Minister Kapil Mishra moves court against order for further probe against him in 2020 riots case
content: The court is also likely to take up for hearing an application filed by Delhi Police against the order of further investigation

title: Robbers cut open ATM in Kalaburagi, steal ₹18 lakh
content: The ATM was loaded with cash around 6 p.m. on April 8, and the robbery took place the following morning

title: No rooms for solo pilgrims visiting Raghavendra Swamy Mutt in Mantralayam
content: Though it is not a newly-introduced rule, many people who travel to the pilgrim town are unaware of the rule

title: A farming collective in Thiruvananthapuram to launch a festival to attract the vacation crowd
content: Ooranvila Krishikoottam to open a 20-day festival on April 10 showcasing millet festival, flower show, aqua show, pet show, and entertainment activities

title: Siddhu Jonnalagadda interview: The humour in ‘Jack’ will not dilute its crux
content: As ‘Jack’ gears up for release, actor Siddhu Jonnalagadda discusses his career post the Tillu films, the funny guy image, and his writing process

title: FIR filed against 11 Congress leaders, 5,000 unnamed party workers for March 27 agitation
content: The Congress had organised the 'Vidhan Sabha Gherao' programme on March 27, 2025 in protest against the "rise in atrocities" against women and girls

title: Telangana’s support to tourism ventures to be presented at South Asia Hotel Investment Conference
content: Telangana Govt aims to attract investments worth ₹15,000 crore in the tourism sector: Jupally Krishna Rao

title: Cabinet Committee on Security approves $7 billion deal to procure 26 Rafale Marine jets from France
content: The deal worth over $7 billion is expected to be signed when the French Defence Minister visits India later this month

title: Raitha Sangha to hold regular santhes in Bengaluru to facilitate farmer-to-consumer direct sale in Karnataka
content: The first such santhe will held at Munivenkatayya Memorial Open Air Theatre in Rajarajeshwarinagar from April 12 to 14

title: MP meets railway officers to review projects in Belagavi district of Karnataka
content: Jagadish Shettar, Lok Sabha member and former Chief Minister, said that he had received several complaints that the design of the newly-constructed road-under-bridge near the level crossing at Sulebavi village is unscientific

title: Kerala Motor Vehicle Inspector’s roadside mridangam jam with motorcycle rider goes viral
content: Impromptu performance was done along Kottayam-Kozhencherry road after a Motor Vehicles Department team stopped a motorcycle for traffic violation. The pillion rider, a musician, turned out to be the official’s friend

title: Murshidabad anti-Waqf Bill violence: Twenty two arrested; internet suspended; Prohibitory Orders imposed
content: Condemning the violence, West Bengal Governor C.V. Ananda Bose said he has directed the Government to take immediate ‘bold action’ to curb the violence and submit a report

title: RBI permits NPCI to enhance transaction limits in UPI for P2M payments
content: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is an umbrella organisation for operating retail payments and settlement systems in India.

title: Fake doctor row: police probe N. John Camm’s ‘forged’ documents; NHRC on ‘malpractice’ by hospital
content: NHRC member Priyank Kanoongo told The Hindu that the hospital had been able to “obtain a licence to perform angioplasty without having a permanent cardiologist” even before N. John Camm came to work there

title: ‘An irrevocable loss’: PM Narendra Modi, political leaders condole demise of Kumari Ananthan
content: Kumari Ananthan made many efforts to popularise the Tamil language and culture, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Ram Rahim gets 21-day furlough
content: Convicted rapist Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 21-day furlough, sparking controversy and criticism from Sikh organisations

title: Jana Sena Party chief Pawan Kalyan’s son shifted from emergency ward to room
content: Some medical tests are being conducted to monitor likely health complications arising from exposure to smoke which affected the child’s lungs

title: ISRO’s “Space on Wheels” offers a peek into Indian Space Programme to students in Karimnagar
content: The mobile space expo offered a peek into ISRO’s history, its significant achievements in exploring space science and technology for multifarious applications for public good

title: Kerala CSR funds scam: High Court rejects bail plea of Ananda Kumar
content: Court directs investigating officers to record the arrest of the petitioner in all cases in which he is implicated as an accused

title: Mallikarjun Kharge calls SC order on TN Governor a ‘slap on the Modi govt’s face’, accuses govt of ‘election fraud’
content: In a blunt message to his party colleagues, Mr Kharge says those unwilling to shoulder responsibility should retire, promises new deal for district-level leadership.

title: Seven former BJD MLAs seek clarification on party MPs’ split voting on Waqf Bill
content: A thorough review is needed to identify those who deviated from the party’s ideology and the circumstances under which they did so, leaders mention in the letter addressed BJD supremo Naveen Patnaik

title: People being denied house due to caste or religion 'disheartening': Maharashtra Governor
content: Bihar and Maharashtra Governors emphasise interfaith dialogue for peace, harmony, and respect in multi-cultural societies

title: Cow slaughter accused arrested after shootout in Uttar Pradesh
content: Ehsaan, a native of Samauli village in Daurala, was arrested from Tehsil Road in Sardhana on charges of slaughtering cows.

title: Three, including two militants, arrested in Manipur for extortion activities
content: “One active cadre of the proscribed Kangleipak Communist Party People’s War Group was arrested from Loitang Khullen area in Imphal West district on April 8, 2025,” the police said

title: Mumbai’s Elphinstone Bridge to close for traffic for two years from April 10
content: The century-old Elphinstone Bridge, connecting Parel and Prabhadevi in central Mumbai, will be shut to facilitate its demolition and reconstruction as part of the Sewri-Worli Elevated Connector project

title: BKU leader Pappu Singh, son and brother gunned down in U.P.'s Fatehpur, three arrested
content: BKU leader Pappu Singh, his son, and brother were shot dead in Fatehpur following an altercation over his tractor blocking a road; three arrested, investigation ongoing

title: Indian Railways says no to meals and toilet breaks for Loco Pilots
content: The decision comes amidst an increasing major train accidents across the country where human error was often attributed as the reason

title: Kunal Kamra rejects purported ‘Bigg Boss’ offer: ‘much rather check into mental hospital’
content: The comedian, under fire for its recent YouTube special, shared a screenshot of his purported WhatsApp conversation with someone who claimed to be “handling the casting for this season of Bigg Boss”

title: Tahawwur Rana, accused in 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, likely to be extradited to India ‘shortly’: report
content: It is also learnt that Rana is not coming to India on April 9 and the extradition process is in the works

title: Ammonia gas leak at factory in Madhya Pradesh, workers shifted
content: The incident took place in Jaora town of the district  at around 10.30 pm on Tuesday, April 8,  2025.

title: BJP MP and former HC judge says it’s possible to distinguish ‘tainted’ from ‘untainted’ candidates in WB recruitment scam
content: Abhijit Gangopadhyay, BJP MP and former  Calcutta HC judge says the OMR (Optical Mark Reader) sheets recovered by the CBI can be made public by the State government; His remark comes after Supreme Court annulled the appointment of 25,752 teachers

title: MPC cuts repo rate by 25 basis points, changes stance to accommodative
content: The MPC also changed it’s stance from neutral to accommodative considering the current global economic situation

title: New law to ensure use of Waqf land for people's welfare: Scindia
content: "The opposition's thinking and ideology is to run the affairs of the Waqf (Board) with monopoly and misuse things (properties). But Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP and government have exposed them," Mr. Scindia

title: Tamilisai Soundararajan pens emotional note on her father Kumari Ananthan’s demise
content: “Whatever you thought you wanted to do for people, we will do it,” said BJP leader Tamilisai Soundarajan, in a tribute to her father and Congressman Kumari Ananthan

title: T.N. CM Stalin, Governor R.N. Ravi, and political leaders pay tribute to Kumari Ananthan
content: Earlier in the day, Mr. Stalin, in a statement, had expressed grief over the demise of Ananthan. “Mr. Kumari Ananthan surrendered himself to the Congress. His demise is a big loss to the Tamil community,” he had said

title: Why is active mobility necessary in India?  | Explained
content: What is active mobility and how is it a sustainable mode of transportation? What is the Karnataka Active Mobility Bill, 2022? How will non-motorised modes of transport increase health benefits? How have other countries integrated active mobility in their infrastructures?

title: ‘Peace process underway’: SC defers plea for probe into 2018 Sukma encounter
content: Chhattisgarh government had earlier opposed the plea, saying that “bogus claims” were made in it and had said photographs attached with the plea were not of the alleged incident

title: XR Creator winners transform the customer experience with immersive tech
content: The winners have made expensive experiments possible for students in schools without resources and are all set to revolutionise healthcare, interior decor, travel, e-commerce, and gaming

title: Registrar General of India cautions hospitals over delay in reporting events of birth, death
content: 90% of births and deaths getting registered, but some hospitals flouting law by asking relatives to do it themselves, says RGI; says all registrars must issue birth and death certificates within seven days

title: Fadnavis says Modi will lead beyond 2029, dismisses succession talk
content: Maharashtra CM’s remarks come after Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut hinted that Modi’s recent visit to RSS headquarters was linked to political retirement

title: IOC to invest ₹61,000 crore in mega petchem project in Odisha
content: IOC has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Odisha government at the State's investor meet, committing to invest ₹61,077 crore in the complex.

title: Scientists at Raman Research Institute develop affordable device for preliminary screening of sickle cell disease
content: According to RRI, the innovative, cost-effective electro-fluidic micropore device, quantifies whole-cell stiffness with high-resolution and high-throughput, with specific focus on screening for SCD.

title: Man murdered on Bengaluru outskirts in suspected plot involving wife; one arrested
content: The deceased, identified as Sameer, a mechanic by profession, was discovered early Monday morning behind a roadside eatery near the Thalaghattapura-Kengeri border

title: II PUC: Girls trump boys again, Udupi emerges as top performer, Yadgir last
content: Yadgir district recorded lowest results with 48.45%, followed by Kalaburagi 55.70%, which ranked last the previous year

title: Kumari Ananthan, former Tamil Nadu Congress chief, dies at 93
content: Ananthan is survived by one son and four daughters, including senior BJP leader and former Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan

title: Supreme Court’s judgment in favour of Tamil Nadu government is historic: P. Wilson
content: Explaining various aspects of the verdict, the Rajya Sabha Member says that from now, the Governors must act on any Bill only as per the aid and advice of the Chief Minister and the Cabinet. The verdict has also made it clear under what circumstances the Governor can refer a Bill to the President. When asked if there is a chance of a review petition, he says it will be faced legally if it comes up

title: Academics expect Vice-Chancellor selection process to begin
content: Currently, 12 universities, including  Madurai Kamaraj University, Anna University, and University of Madras, are without Vice-Chancellors

title: Leaders, including S. Ramadoss, welcome Supreme Court verdict on powers of Governor
content: TNCC president K. Selvaperunthagai says the Supreme Court condemned Mr. Ravi’s anti-people stance and a clear verdict has been delivered

title: In 2021, Appavu, P. Wilson demanded setting of time limit for Governors to give assent to Bills
content: At the 82nd All India Presiding Officers Conference in Shimla in November 2021, Mr. Appavu had said when Governors stalled giving assent to a Bill, they are virtually overruling the will of the people of the State

title: Appeasement politics brought Congress to power but ordinary Muslims faced neglect: PM Modi on Waqf law
content: PM Modi said the Waqf law enacted in 2013 by the Congress-led UPA government created an illusion that the Act was above the Constitution.

title: Empuraan left a mark on a generation about Gujarat riots, says N.S. Madhavan
content: Mr. Madhavan pointed out, however, that the Hindutva forces neither hit the streets in protest against the movie nor engaged in any violent actions, but limited their opposition to the online media

title: New bridge across Avalurpet railway gate in Tiruvannamalai to end motorists ordeal
content: The new bridge was a long-standing demand of residents, and it will be a great relief for the public as it will ease traffic in the town, says a motorist

title: Chennai celebrates Ramzan and Ramanavami with fervour
content: Closely following Ramzan, which ended with Eid on March 31, Ramanavami saw devotees get immersed in the festivities in Chennai

title: Boat Mail Express - A blend of rail and sea travel that left a lasting legacy in the history of South Asian transport
content: The Boat Mail Express linked India and Ceylon for more than half-a-century. After the Pamban Bridge was opened in February 1914, the train started running between Madras and Dhanushkodi. Ferries were operated from Dhanushkodi to Talaimannar in Ceylon, a distance of 22 miles. From Talaimannar, another train took passengers to Colombo

title: Luka: Was trash-talking fan, not ref, when ejected
content: Luka Doncic says he was trash-talking with a courtside fan in the fourth quarter of the Lakers' loss to the Thunder when an official thought Doncic's ire was directed at him, leading to an ejection for the Lakers guard.

title: Cavs wrap up East's top seed, 'hungry for more'
content: Darius Garland scored 28 points, and the Cavaliers clinched the top seed in the Eastern Conference with a 135-113 win over the Chicago Bulls on Tuesday night.

title: Ex-MLBers Dotel, Blanco die in nightclub tragedy
content: Former major leaguers Octavio Dotel and Tony Blanco were among the more than 90 people who died after the roof of a nightclub collapsed in the Dominican Republic early Tuesday.

title: Grizz's Wells awake, alert but has broken wrist
content: Grizzlies rookie Jaylen Wells is awake, alert and moving his extremities but sustained a broken wrist after a scary fall against the Hornets.

title: Skenes ships career-worst 5 runs in loss to Cards
content: Paul Skenes might still be relatively new in the major leagues, but the Pittsburgh Pirates star isn't new to baseball and he won't be sweating a shaky start Tuesday night in which he gave up a career-worst five runs to the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Comeback Canucks make history with furious finish
content: In a stunning 6-5 overtime victory Tuesday over the Dallas Stars, the Vancouver Canucks, still chasing a playoff spot in the Western Conference, made NHL history, becoming the first team to overcome a three-goal deficit in the final minute of regulation.

title: Auburn's Freeze 'at peace' with cancer diagnosis
content: As he plans out his third season on the Auburn sidelines, Tigers coach Hugh Freeze, 55, told ESPN's Chris Low this week that he is "at peace" with his cancer diagnosis, and now, following a 5-7 season, "we've got to go compete and win some more games."

title: Jets C Lucius, 21, retires with tissue disorder
content: Chaz Lucius, a 21-year-old center and former first-round pick for the Winnipeg Jets who played this season for the Manitoba Moose of the AHL, announced his retirement on Tuesday due to a hereditary tissue disorder called Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

title: What's next for Denver after firing Michael Malone? NBA insiders debate the Nuggets' shocking move
content: The Nuggets stunned the league by moving on from their coach and GM. Why now? Where does Denver go from here? NBA insiders weigh in.

title: LeBron James, Luka Doncic and the one player who could swing the playoffs for the Lakers
content: Luka Doncic and LeBron James are constants. But in a loaded West, Austin Reaves might be the difference between a deep playoff run for the Lakers and an early exit.

title: Our hottest early MLB hot takes: From a Cy Young trifecta to an MVP candidate you've never heard of
content: What can we glean from two weeks of baseball? Enough to make our experts go all-in on their boldest predictions.

title: How has the torpedo bat changed the industry?
content: The torpedo bat's rise has changed the industry for the companies that make them. Here is one bat-maker's story.

title: 2025-26 men’s college basketball rankings: Way-Too-Early Top 25
content: Florida captured the national title Monday night, but Houston is already the favorite at the top for next season.

title: 'A big swing-and-miss': Has Deshaun Watson played his last down in the NFL?
content: Browns owner Jimmy Haslam admitted for the first time last week that the 2022 trade for Watson was a failure. What's next for Cleveland and its QB?

title: 'I just have a good feel about the place': A decade later, can Jordan Spieth do it again?
content: Ten years ago, Jordan Spieth rushed through his lone coronation at the Masters. He still believes he can get another shot.

title: Who had the most painful tournament loss -- Duke or Houston?
content: Some losses are understandable; others will haunt us forever. Let's rank every 2025 men's NCAA tournament defeat, from least to most devastating.

title: Move over, McGregor: Why Chandler is better off with Pimblett
content: It might seem counterintuitive, but for Michael Chandler, Paddy Pimblett is an upgrade from Conor McGregor.

title: R.C. Slocum is the 'last one of those guys'
content: It will be a long time before another figure spends half a century working for a program the way that Slocum did at Texas A&M.

title: Arsenal secure a Champions League win for the ages as Real Madrid hope for Bernabéu magic
content: This was Arsenal's finest hour in Champions League history, and it's hard to believe even Real Madrid can wage a comeback in the quarterfinal's return leg.

title: Rice's 'magic' free kicks see Arsenal stun Madrid
content: Declan Rice said his free kick heroics against Real Madrid left him "speechless" but insisted Arsenal are targeting Champions League glory.

title: Courtois: 'I take responsibility' for Rice free kick
content: Goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said he "takes responsibility" for Declan Rice's stunning opening free kick goal in Real Madrid's 3-0 Champions League quarterfinal first leg defeat to Arsenal on Tuesday.

title: Villa urge calm from PSG fans over Martínez feud
content: Aston Villa's Youri Tielemans has urged Paris Saint-Germain supporters to "stick to football" if they taunt goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez.

title: Premier League seals 5th place in 2025-26 UCL
content: The Premier League will have five teams in the Champions League next season after it secured one of the extra places for performance by its clubs.

title: Galaxy struggles continue as Tigres end cup run
content: Tigres held off a rally from the LA Galaxy to win 3-2 on Tuesday night in their Concacaf Champions Cup quarterfinal second leg and advance to the semifinals.

title: Doctor: Wrong to send Maradona home after op
content: A doctor testified Tuesday at the trial of seven medical professionals accused of negligence in the death of Diego Maradona that the...

title: Yamal on rise with Barça: 'As if I'm playing PES'
content: Lamine Yamal has told ESPN it feels as if he's "playing Pro Evolution Soccer [sic]" as the teenager targets a treble with Barcelona this season.

title: Brady on Birmingham promotion: 'Not done yet'
content: Birmingham City have secured promotion from League One after a 2-1 win at Peterborough ensured they will return to the Championship at the first time of asking.

title: Which team takes the top spot after Week 9?
content: How far did the Gators fall? Which teams rose the most? Check out our updated college softball Top 25 poll, plus players to watch.

title: Bullpen stock watch: Surprise closer in Texas
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: 2025-26 women's college basketball rankings: Way-Too-Early Top 25
content: As this season's title is won, we take a look at the women's college basketball Way-Too-Early Top 25 for 2025-26.

title: Latson, Miles open 1-2 in 2025-26 women's college basketball transfer rankings
content: Florida State's Ta'Niya Latson, Notre Dame's Olivia Miles and OSU's Cotie McMahon top our transfer rankings.

title: Giants unveil latest City Connect uniform, pay homage to San Francisco's rich music history
content: The San Francisco Giants teamed up with Bay Area musical artists for their 2025 City Connect uniform.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Reijnders key to Guardiola's Man City rebuild
content: Tijjani Reijnders could be one of a number of new faces at Man City this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Lerone Murphy still undefeated, no longer unranked at featherweight
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Telangana govt retains NVS Reddy as HMRL and HAML MD for one more year
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: ‘Speak Marathi, not English’: Woman with baby thrashed for saying 'excuse me'
content: In Dombivli, a dispute erupted when Poonam Gupta greeted her neighbors in English, leading to a violent altercation. The Dhoble family allegedly assaulted Gupta, her friend, and her husband after taking offense to the language. Initially, police filed a non-cognizable complaint, but after CCTV footage surfaced showing the Dhobles' aggression, they are reconsidering.

title: 40-yr-old woman elopes with would-be son-in-law days before wedding
content: In a shocking turn of events, a 40-year-old woman from Aligarh eloped with her daughter's 20-year-old fiancé just days before their wedding. The couple allegedly absconded with Rs 2.5 lakh in cash and jewellery, prompting a police investigation. Authorities are currently searching for the duo, with suspicions pointing towards Uttarakhand as a possible hideout.

title: The making of six-hitting Priyansh Arya: A Gambhir touch!
content: Priyansh Arya, who was the top-scorer for Delhi in last year’s Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy with 222 runs at the strike rate of 166.91, grabbed eyeballs in the inaugural Delhi Premier League. Playing for South Delhi Superstarz, Arya slammed 608 runs in 10 innings with a whopping strike rate of 198.69, with two centuries and four fifty-plus total.

title: 'Rana should be hanged': Father of cop killed in 26/11 terror attacks
content: Tahawwur Rana is being extradited after the US Supreme Court rejected his plea seeking extradition to India.

title: Walmart boycott: World's largest retailer tells protesters, 'we are America's ...'
content: Walmart is facing a week-long boycott, "Walmart Blackout," led by People’s Union USA over DEI rollbacks and tax concerns. While Walmart defends its community contributions and tax payments, critics argue the DEI changes undermine workplace diversity. Data suggests Walmart is more resilient to boycotts than Target, which faced significant backlash for similar initiatives.

title: Is it official? Chahal shares photo with Mahvash amid relationship talks
content: Yuzvendra Chahal has sparked relationship rumours after sharing a photo with RJ Mahvash on Instagram, following his split from Dhanashree Verma. Mahvash, seen supporting Punjab Kings at an IPL match, posted a heartfelt message for Chahal. Chahal responded warmly, praising her support. Their social media exchange has caught fans’ attention and stirred speculation.

title: Explained: What's the difference between 'Retired Hurt' and 'Retired Out'?
content: In a rare tactical move during Indian Premier League 2025, CSK retired out Devon Conway on 69 in the 18th over vs Punjab Kings. Replaced by Jadeja, the decision aimed to boost the chase but failed. It marked the season’s second such instance, sparking debate on “retired out” vs “retired hurt.”

title: How room full of GMs put an end to FIDE vs Freestyle Chess row
content: Viswanathan Anand's withdrawal from the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Germany dealt a major blow to hopes of reconciliation between FIDE and Freestyle Chess. Tensions escalated after a dress code dispute involving Magnus Carlsen, with Anand enforcing FIDE rules. Despite backchannel talks, Freestyle players ultimately chose to crown their own “Freestyle Chess Champion,” sidelining FIDE’s authority.

title: Apple is no longer the world’s most valuable company, loses its position to…
content: Microsoft has surpassed Apple as the world's most valuable company amidst a market downturn triggered by new tariffs. Apple's stock declined sharply due to its reliance on China, potentially leading to iPhone price increases. To mitigate tariff impacts, Apple plans to shift some iPhone production to India, while US stores see increased iPhone sales ahead of possible price hikes.

title: 'I haven't seen many better knocks': Ponting lauds Arya's attitude
content: Priyansh Arya’s blazing 103 off 42 balls powered Punjab Kings to a vital 18-run win over Chennai Super Kings. More than his record-equaling ton, it was his fearless comeback after a first-ball duck that earned high praise from coach Ricky Ponting, epitomising the team’s fighting spirit and attitude.

title: Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia’s ‘Gyaan’: The problem with 99% engineers in India is …
content: Sabeer Bhatia, co-founder of Hotmail, has criticized India's engineering ecosystem for fostering management-oriented graduates rather than builders and innovators, claiming that most engineers lack practical skills needed for technological advancement. "99% of Indian who graduate as engineers join management and start giving gyaan to everybody. Where is the work ethic, where they really work with their hands and really go and build some stuff?" Bhatia asked during a podcast with YouTuber Singh in USA.

title: Morning Digest: Trump’s sweeping tariffs, including 104% on China, to take effect today; Registrar General of India warns over delay in reporting events of birth and death, and more

title: "India, China Relationship Is...": Beijing's Message After Trump's 104% Tariff
content: Donald Trump's tariffs are doing, it appears, what decades of political and diplomatic wrangling could not, at least with any great degree of success - to get India and China to work together.

title: "Only When We Summon...": Top Court On Emergency Aid In Road Accident Cases
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday reprimanded the centre for failing to implement a cashless medical treatment plan that includes access to emergency aid during the 'golden hour' for road accident survivors.

title: "Kissing My A**, Trying To Make Deals": Trump On Countries Hit By Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump mocked tariff-hit nations on Tuesday (local time), stating that they were ready to don anything while trying to negotiate with him.

title: "You Have Grandchildren?": Top Court's Deadline For Packaged Food Labels
content: The Supreme Court has set a three-month deadline for the Centre to implement food safety norms that make it mandatory to display key information about packaged food items on containers. Hearing a Public Interest Litigation, the bench of Justice JB Pa

title: India Gets Rafale Boost, Rs 63,000-Crore Deal Cleared For 26 Navy Fighters
content: India will buy 26 Rafale M fighter jets - i.e., the marine variants - for the Navy in a record government-to-government deal worth over Rs 63,000 crore, sources told NDTV Tuesday.

title: 26/11 Accused Tahawwur Rana Being Flown To India On Special Plane: Sources
content: Tahawwur Rana, an accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, has exhausted his legal options in the US and is likely to be extradited to India soon, sources have said. A multi-agency team from India is coordinating with authorities in the US

title: New Trouble For India? Trump Says US Will Tariff Pharmaceutical Imports Soon
content: Continuing his economic onslaught, US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that Washington is planning to announce a "major" tariff on pharmaceutical imports soon.

title: US Woman Travels To This Indian Village To Marry Her Instagram Friend
content: A US woman has travelled thousands of miles to marry the love of her life - a man who comes from a remote village in Andhra Pradesh.

title: 3 Lakh Indian Students Face Uncertainty As US Bill Plans End Of Work Visa
content: Indian students are the largest beneficiaries of the OPT program, with 97,556 participants in the 2023-2024 academic year, a 41% increase from the previous year.

title: Opposition Alleges Chittaranjan Park Fish Sellers Threatened, BJP Says "False"
content: A popular fish market in south Delhi's posh Chittaranjan Park neighbourhood is at the Centre of a massive political row after a viral video showed some people objecting to the sale of fish next to a temple and saying this was hurting their sentiments

title: "Your Idol Is 'Girgit'": Navjot Sidhu, Ambati Rayudu In Ugly Spat On TV
content: Ambati Rayudu and Navjot Singh Sidhu had a clash on Live TV during the Punjab Kings vs Chennai Super Kings match in IPL 2025.

title: Kangana Ranaut's "Rs 1 Lakh" Power Bill Claim, Congress' "Cheap" Stunt Jab
content: BJP MP and actor-turned-politician Kangana Ranaut has alleged that she received an electricity bill of Rs 1 lakh for her unoccupied residence in Himachal Pradesh's Manali.

title: How Premier League teams can qualify for Champions League, Europe this season
content: a staggering 11 English teams could potentially play in the top three competitions . the premier league will have five teams in the UCL next season . there are a whole host of clauses and considerations that could affect where the places go . here's your guide to european qualification in the Premier League .

title: Inter's Martínez and Thuram could be Inzaghi's X factors in the Champions League
content: Inter beat Bayern Munich 2-1 in their UEFA Champions League quarterfinal first leg . a striker partnership was more than evident at the Allianz Arena on Tuesday night . the two strikers combined brilliantly on the first goal, with Thuram's sugar sweet layoff .

title: After 15-year wait to seek revenge, sons lynch dad's killer with sticks in UP
content: In a chilling act of revenge, Mahawat, recently released after serving 15 years for murdering Rampal, was lynched in broad daylight in Hardoi. A mob led by Rampal's sons, Rahul and Beeru, avenged their father's death, mirroring the original crime by beating Mahawat to death with sticks.

title: Sikh high priests declare ‘religious emergency’ in Punjab
content: Citing a "religious emergency" in Punjab, the five Sikh high priests have instructed all Sikh preachers to return to the state. They are tasked with adopting 10 villages each for intensive religious preaching over the next four months.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Actor Darshan skips court hearing citing backache
content: Actor Darshan, accused in the S Renukaswamy murder case, missed Tuesday's court hearing, citing a backache and ongoing filming for his movie, Devil. While his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda and other co-accused appeared, Darshan's advocate filed for exemption and requested the release of seized mobile phones.

title: Jaya Bachchan calls Abhishek and Shweta her greatest achievement - Exclusive
content: Jaya Bachchan is celebrating her 77th birthday and in an exclusive conversation with us, she shared reflections on her illustrious career and motherhood. She considers her children, Abhishek and Shweta, her greatest achievements. Throughout her diverse film career, she has played various roles but particularly enjoyed her portrayal of a villain in the movie 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani.'

title: Patient follows doctor and seeks consultation while he was jogging: This is what the doc did
content: The life of a doctor in India is a demanding blend of dedication, pressure, and purpose. From grueling years of education to relentless hospital shifts, the journey is one of constant sacrifice. Many doctors clock in long hours, especially in overcrowded public hospitals, often with scarce resources.  Dr. Sudhir Kumar’s recent social media post highlights the often-overlooked importance of self-care among doctors.

title: 20 years of King Charles-Camilla's marriage: When Harry, William begged him not to remarry
content: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are celebrating their 20th wedding anniversary with new portraits taken in Rome during their state visit to Italy.

title: Govt clears mega Rs 64,000cr deal to buy 26 Rafale-Marine jets from France
content: India's Cabinet Committee on Security has approved a nearly Rs 64,000 crore deal with France for 26 Rafale-Marine fighter jets for INS Vikrant. The agreement includes 22 single-seat and four twin-seat trainers, along with weapons and support. Delivery is expected within 37 to 65 months.

title: How much will your loan EMIs come down with repo rate cut? Explained
content: RBI has given loan borrowers reason to cheer with two back-to-back repo rate cuts in this calendar year. This is likely to translate into lower EMIs in the coming months. We explain the math:

title: Waqf Act: SP moves SC against new law, says 'discriminates against Muslims'
content: The Samajwadi Party has filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the Waqf Amendment Bill, 2025, joining over 10 other petitioners, including Congress, AIMIM, and Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. They argue the Act discriminates against Muslims. The Centre has submitted a caveat seeking to be heard. Hearings are expected around April 15.

title: 'Been harshly treated by more than 1 man': Kayla Nicole clarifies Kelce wasn’t the only
content: Kayla Nicole is opening up about the emotional challenges she faced while dating high-profile men, including Travis Kelce, revealing the toxic dynamics and public scrutiny that took a toll on her. She emphasizes the importance of prioritizing self-love and setting boundaries after experiencing harsh treatment and online harassment. Now, Kayla is choosing privacy and emotional safety in her relationships.

title: Kerala madrassa teacher gets 187 years in jail for sex assault
content: Mohammed Rafi, a madrasa teacher, received a 187-year prison sentence. A special court in Taliparamba delivered the verdict. He was convicted of sexually assaulting a 16-year-old student. The abuse occurred repeatedly during the Covid-19 lockdown. Rafi also received a fine of Rs 9.10 lakh. He was previously convicted of similar crimes. The police registered a case following the girl's revelation.

title: 'Didi will protect you': Mamata says Waqf Act will not be implemented in Bengal
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has called for unity among minority communities amidst growing unrest over the Waqf Act, 2025, assuring protection of their rights and property. She accused the Centre of divisive politics, while violent protests erupted in Murshidabad following the Act's implementation, leading to internet restrictions.

title: Bihar Minister Slammed For Distributing Blankets In 40 Degrees Heat
content: On a hot summer day when temperatures ranged between 35 and 40 degrees Celsius, Bihar Sports Minister Surendra Mehta distributed over 500 blankets among poor residents of Ahiyapur village under his Bachhwara Assembly constituency.

title: India Gets Taste Of Satellite-Based Internet During Myanmar Quake Ops
content: India tried its first real-time use of satellite-based Internet during New Delhi's Operation Brahma - providing aid to the quake-hit residents of Myanmar.

title: India Gets Taste Of Satellite-Based Internet During Myanmar Quake Ops
content: India tried its first real-time use of satellite-based Internet during New Delhi's Operation Brahma - providing aid to the quake-hit residents of Myanmar.

title: India open to zero duty on imports from US in PLI
content: India is considering zero-duty imports from the US across various sectors, including those under the PLI scheme, to expedite a bilateral trade agreement and reverse reciprocal tariffs. This offer is contingent on strict rules of origin, requiring 30-40% value addition.

title: 'Terrible experience': Ex-WHO chief slams Air India; airline responds
content: Former ICMR chief Soumya Swaminathan has publicly criticized Air India, labeling her experience as "terrible." Despite her loyalty and sufficient mileage, she was unable to upgrade her Nairobi to Delhi flight. Swaminathan expressed frustration over the illogical reasons provided by the airline. Air India responded, requesting her booking details to investigate.

title: 'I am not Sanjay of Mahabharata': RBI governor on Trump tariff impact
content: Amidst global economic uncertainties fueled by trade tariffs, the RBI has cut the repo rate to 6.5% and adopted an accommodative stance, signaling a potential for further rate reductions. While aiming for growth-supportive monetary policy, the RBI acknowledges challenges and revised downwards GDP growth projections for FY 2025-26 to 6.5%.

title: 'Blatant oxymoron,' says BJP as Cong moves to reclaim Sardar Patel's legacy
content: The BJP has criticised the Congress for invoking Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's legacy during the AICC session in Ahmedabad, calling it politically motivated. BJP leaders questioned Congress's sincerity, suggesting they would have named their headquarters 'Sardar Bhavan' if they truly respected Patel.

title: 'Gagged, stabbed, body thrown into duct': 10-yr-old raped, murdered in Thane
content: In Mumbra, a 20-year-old unemployed man has been arrested for the sexual assault and murder of a 10-year-old girl. He lured the victim from her friends with the promise of toys, took her to his apartment, and sexually assaulted her. After gagging and stabbing her, he disposed of her body in a building duct, where it was later discovered.

title: Trump tariffs impact: Apple looks to make more iPhones in India
content: Amidst rising US tariffs, Apple is strategically considering expanding iPhone production in India, aiming to mitigate financial impacts on US-bound exports. The company has already expedited shipments from India and plans to increase manufacturing there.

title: 200 fall ill in Greater Noida due to water contamination — Safety tips to follow
content: Ajnara Homes Society in Greater Noida faces a health crisis. Over 200 residents are sick, possibly from contaminated water. Authorities suspect the groundwater supply. The overhead tank was last cleaned in September. A medical camp will be set up. Water testing is underway. Residents report stomach pain. The incident highlights the need for regular water tank maintenance in residential societies.

title: Russia invites PM Modi to May 9 victory day parade in Moscow
content: Russia has formally invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to attend the Victory Day celebrations in Moscow on May 9, commemorating the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany. Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko confirmed the invitation, stating that discussions are underway.

title: 'Girgit agar kisi ka... ': Sidhu trolls Rayudu during IPL 2025 commentary
content: During an Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 match, Ambati Rayudu and Navjot Singh Sidhu engaged in a heated argument after Rayudu accused Sidhu of disloyalty, leading to a viral response from Sidhu. Rayudu also clashed with Sanjay Bangar over Rohit Sharma's role in Mumbai Indians (MI), asserting that Hardik Pandya should lead independently.

title: Tariff-hit countries 'dying to make a deal': Donald Trump
content: Donald Trump claimed several nations are eager to negotiate with the U.S. following his tariff actions, even using colorful language to describe their eagerness. He mentioned productive calls with Vietnam and South Korea, and a meeting with Israel's Prime Minister. Trump also dismissed lawmakers' attempts to control tariffs, asserting his expertise in negotiation.

title: Watch: Scuffle breaks out between AAP MLA and BJP leaders in J&K assembly
content: The Jammu and Kashmir legislative assembly faced disruption for the third consecutive day, leading to a three-hour adjournment. The uproar stemmed from demands for a discussion on the Waqf Amendment Act, recently passed in Parliament. National Conference members and BJP legislators stormed the Well of the House, staging protests after the Speaker disallowed an adjournment motion on the issue.

title: 'Second independence battle, late night Parl session': Kharge's big attack on BJP
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge launched a strong attack on the BJP-led government, alleging electoral fraud in Maharashtra and questioning the credibility of EVMs. He accused the PM Modi's government of dismantling democratic institutions, selling national assets to crony capitalists, and undermining constitutional values. Kharge also criticised the government's economic policies, price hikes, and communal politics.

title: We’ll seek answers when Kunal Kamra comes to Mumbai: Sena MLA
content: Shiv Sena MLA Murji Patel said that they will confront Kunal Kamra when he visits Mumbai. This is regarding Kamra's 'traitor' remark against Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde. Patel alleges Kamra is avoiding police summons. An FIR was filed against Kamra at Khar police station. Kamra has been booked under sections related to public mischief and defamation.

title: 'Sense of alienation within Muslims': Mehbooba slams Omar-Rijiju tulip garden stroll
content: Kashmiri politicians are criticizing Omar Abdullah for his interactions with Union ministers, especially after the Waqf Amendment Act. Mehbooba Mufti condemned Abdullah's welcome to Kiren Rijiju, viewing it as undermining Indian Muslims. Sajad Lone echoed this, stating Abdullah should have avoided Rijiju as a protest. Abdullah also welcomed Amit Shah, further intensifying tensions among regional parties in the Valley.

title: IPL 2025: Ashwin surpasses Bhuvi in elite bowlers list
content: R Ashwin etched his name in IPL history, surpassing Bhuvneshwar Kumar to become the third-highest wicket-taker with 185 wickets. Yuzvendra Chahal and Piyush Chawla remain ahead of him. However, Chennai Super Kings faced defeat against Punjab Kings, despite Priyansh Arya's remarkable century. Punjab Kings secured a victory by 18 runs, with Arya earning 'Player of the Match'.

title: Why RBI cut repo rate by 25 basis points to support GDP growth
content: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6%, shifting its stance to accommodative amid global economic uncertainties. While the GDP growth forecast for FY 2025-26 has been slightly lowered to 6.5%, the CPI inflation outlook remains benign at 4%.

title: Tahawwur Rana extradition: Delhi, Mumbai jails being readied for 26/11 mastermind
content: Tahawwur Rana, the mastermind behind the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, is expected to arrive in India, prompting special security arrangements in Delhi and Mumbai jails. Rana, an LeT member, facilitated David Headley's reconnaissance for the attacks and even gloated over the casualties.

title: Murshidabad violence: Police vehicles torched, 4 cops injured in stone-pelting
content: Following protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act in West Bengal's Murshidabad district, the situation is now calm but under control with prohibitory orders and internet suspension in place. Violence erupted earlier, leading to stone-pelting, vehicle fires, and police intervention, resulting in injuries and detentions.

title: Lil Wayne visits Bill Belichick in Chapel Hill, receives UNC football jersey
content: With spring practices in full swing around the country, the  North Carolina Tar Heels  welcomed a visitor with some serious star power over the weekend -- Lil Wayne. The famed rapper visited the Tar Heels' football facilities Saturday in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, where he met head coach Bill Belichick, among others. Two Legends.  pic.twitter.com/7gWVhunTZN Lil Wayne received a custom North Carolina football jersey, with his nickname "Tunechi" and the No. 17, a nod to his roots in New Orleans' 17th Ward. Shhh...The Fireman Coming. 🔥  pic.twitter.com/Q4DLrYlMM1 Lil Wayne is a known  Green Bay Packers   superfan , but he has also expressed support for Belichick in his new position. When the longtime  New England Patriots  coach was  officially hired by  the Tar Heels in December, the artist congratulated Belichick  on social media  -- writing "Man much respect 2da GOAT coach." "Tha Carter VI," Lil Wayne's latest studio album, is slated for release in June.

title: Scottie Scheffler's success on the course starts with his work off it
content: Defending champion swung and made contact, replicating his sliding swing . he made his left foot slip and fall into the bunker while his right leg folded awkwardly beneath him . the 2024 masters will be held on saturday .

title: Hurt Over Rs 2-3 Crore Loss, Mary Kom Leaves Husband Onler: Report
content: the trouble in the couple's paradise is said to have started after Mary's husband, Karung Onkholer . the couple had spent Rs 2-3 crores while campaigning, but the defeat in the elections left the two shattered . onler, on the other hand, is in Delhi .

title: RBI Cuts Key Rate To 6% As Trump Tariffs Kick In, Home Loans To Be Cheaper
content: the RBI has cut repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down to 6% . this will reduce borrowing costs for banks and enable them to lend money to individual customers at lower rates . the RBI governor said the financial year begins on an anxious note for the global economy .
